name: Plaza Hotel and Suites Eau Claire

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an interesting hotel. The hotel looks sort of run down from the outside, but it seems like the staff do their best to keep the rooms very clean. We got a room in the Tower. The shape of the room was quite odd since the entrance area was narrow, and widened towards the window, but spacious enough over all. The bathroom was clean as well. The hotel has a pool and a fitness center. The free breakfast in the morning wasn't anything great. Cereal, muffins, donuts etc. The hotel provided a good stay for the price.
reviews.title: Good Value Hotel

reviews.text: We drive through Eau Claire every year and the hotels there (and in all of northern WI and MN) are way over-priced. Even the cheap-o chains can cost $100-120.
reviews.title: Great hotel and price
A Special Treat at the Plaza
reviews.text: the Plaza doesn't look like much from the outside. But the people were very, very nice. Our room (in the "tower" with a king bed) was great. Better toiletries that you'd expect. Better sheets. Better pillows. Large room. Microwave. Fridge. Couch. Coffee table. Coffee maker. Hair dryer. Room service.

reviews.title: Definately the Best in Eau Claire
reviews.text: We didn't try the pool or restaurants. (We recommend Draganetti's for Italian, at Clairmont and 53.)

reviews.title: Thanks Plaza!!
reviews.text: We paid $85.99 and it was a bargain. We will definitely stay there every year and might even stay longer and do some touristing just because it's such a nice place.

reviews.title: Great Service at The Plaza
reviews.text: While traveling through Eau Claire I had a few car problems and the staff at The Plaza did outstanding in helping me out. I hadn't planned on staying in Eau Claire but with the car problems I had to. The staff at The Plaza did their best to help me out by giving me a great rate for the room, plus I got a great meal and a few drinks in their lounge from a superb staff. They even let me stay past checkout time until my car was ready. I would definately reccomend The Plaza to anyone traveling to Eau Claire.

reviews.title: Great amenities and service
reviews.text: The Plaza has more amenities than any hotel in Eau Claire. The staff you can tell were eager to help us in any way. The hotel granted is very busy and is a destination hotel with water toys like "Willie the Water Snake" that the kids loved. We had a refrigerator and microwave in our room and found out later that all 233 of their rooms have them. When we asked for extra towels we received them within 10 minutes. The kids also enjoyed the arcade. Very friendly bar and restaurant staff and the Sunday buffet breakfast topped off our stay. The hotel advertises great value and great rates and they deliver.

reviews.title: Not worth the money
reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel, we had hopes that our stay would be good. Those were quickly blown away. They had booked some kind of tournament and there were teenagers everywhere. We have a 2 1/2 year old and she could not even get in the kiddie pool because teens were playing in it and chasing each other through it. the hotel did not make them get out and go to the big pool. They did however allow them to run amok until about midnight yelling in the halls.

The next morning our wake up call did not go off. We overslept and raced down to breakfast only to find they were picking it up 5 minutes early. We asked if we could get something really quickly and were told no. My daughters tried to get something from the cart and the worker shoved the cart away from them.
reviews.title: Terrible Service!
Pool Packed with Birthday Parties
reviews.text: When we checked out and were asked how we enjoyed the stay, they looked at us and said, "oh sorry." I not only will never stay at this hotel again, but I want to discourage everyone from staying here. It was horrible service and a terrible value. It was the last day of vacation and we thought we would spend a little extra for a last big bang and it was not worth it.

reviews.title: Plaza not perfect but an upgrade will help!
reviews.text: I was booked into this hotel while speaking at the NWEA conference in Eau Claire. I spend over 80 nights per year in hotels and am picky about where I stay. After reading the reviews, I was quite nervous; however I entered with my eyes open.

reviews.title: Plaza not what I expected
reviews.text: I was assigned to a room on the 3rd floor and heard traffic noise as I opened the door to enter the room. Back downstairs I went. I was offered a 1st floor room right next to the lobby ( also noisy) and told them I may have to stay somewhere else.

reviews.title: Not exactly what I expected
reviews.text: VOILA! I was upgraded to a LOVELY suite that was just perfect! Additionally, the food is excellent in the restaurant and I thought it was a good value!

description: The Plaza Hotel & Suites has 233 guest rooms. Each room offers a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, iron and ironing board, hairdryer, cable TV, and free high-speed wireless Internet. Guests of all ages enjoy our Atrium Courtyard Pool Area, including a large swimming pool, children’s pool, and jacuzzi. In addition, each of our guests receive our full, hot complimentary breakfast each morning of their stay. Casual dining within our facility is available at Burgundy’s Restaurant, which features a full menu for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Daily chef specials and our Friday fish buffet are always favorites among guests. Our on-site sports bar, Brewski’s Pub & Grill, offers daily drink specials and "happy hour," as well as a lounge where guests can relax and watch their favorite game. A selection of burgers, sandwiches, and appetizers are available for dinner or a late night snack.
